meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily managed or controlled.
meanings.sent1: Her tractabilities made her the perfect candidate for the job.
meanings.sent2: The tractabilities of the new software system impressed the team.
meanings.sent3: His tractabilities were so high that even the mischievous puppy obeyed him.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's tractabilities over the rowdy class were like a magician's spell.
meanings.sent5: The tractabilities of the puzzle game made it enjoyable for all ages.

meanings.definition: The capacity to be easily influenced or persuaded.
meanings.sent1: The politician relied on her tractabilities to win over the voters.
meanings.sent2: His tractabilities in the matter made him a target for manipulation.
meanings.sent3: The tractabilities of the children were tested by the persuasive salesman.
meanings.sent4: Her tractabilities were like a sponge, absorbing every idea presented to her.
meanings.sent5: The tractabilities of the audience were evident as they cheered for the speaker.
